sections.text: A special prayer during a solar or lunar eclipse—whether total or partial—is a confirmed sunnah in authentic hadiths (al-Bukhari, Muslim, et al.). It consists of two rak‘ahs, each containing two prolonged ruku‘s. It is preferable to pray in congregation but may be offered individually.
Niyyah & Beginning: Form the intention for the eclipse prayer. Begin as in any other prayer: stand (qiyam), say “Allahu akbar,” and perform the opening takbir.

items: Qiyam & Recitation: Recite Surat al-Fatihah and then a long portion of the Qur’an, prolonging both.
First Ruku‘: Bow (ruku‘) and prolong it.
Return to Qiyam: Stand up, say “Rabbana wa laka-l-hamd,” then recite al-Fatihah again followed by another long portion of the Qur’an (slightly shorter than before).
Second Ruku‘: Bow for a second prolonged ruku‘.
Sujud & Completion: Complete the rak‘ah as usual, prolonging the prostration (sujud).

sections.text: Repeat the same sequence as the first rak‘ah: long qiyam with recitation, two prolonged ruku‘s, and extended prostrations. End with the sitting (julus) and taslim (salam) as in ordinary prayer.
Prolong the entire prayer for the duration of the eclipse. If the eclipse ends sooner, use the remaining time for dhikr, du‘a’, and seeking forgiveness.
The Prophet (ﷺ) prescribed giving charity at the time of the eclipse prayer as an additional sunnah.
